The text showed statistics on how many Americans use social media sites. The correct answer is A.
As the text mentions, social media users are actively sharing news with each other, this in turn shapes which news are being distributed. The correct answer is B.
The first two sentences of this portion of the text suggest that people who use Facebook for news do not spend enough time on reading the news as they should. The correct answer is C.

As the article mentions, people who go to news sites directly are more engaged in reading the news. Therefore, if news organizations want people to read more of their news, it would be good to make digital news more easy to access for users. The correct answer is B.
As the second to fourth sentence suggest, Facebook has more diverse news topics, and is mostly for entertainment, whereas Twitter is primarily used for breaking news events. The correct answer is A.
The example of the Snowden NSA story given by the text shows that people don't always use social media for all news. The correct answer is B.

The last sentence of this article suggests that people tend to be sensitive about sharing dissenting information. Since social media makes it easy to distribute news both faster and more widespread, this might be one of the reasons why people would not want to share opinions that would result in an outpouring of large voices of dissent. The correct answer is C.
